result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory M Pawlak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for DNA sample

Defendant Gregory M Pawlak in court with attorney Nila Robinson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
from Defense enclosing payment

Defendant Gregory M Pawlak in court with attorney Nila Robinson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Defense clarifies money amount listed on plea questionnaire, clarifies that uncharged allegations will not be charged. State makes statement regarding uncharged possession of meth paraphernalia, is not aware of any other charges. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with status as second and subsequent offender. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defense requests that sentencing be put off to allow Defendant time to pay, is not requesting PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 11:30 am.
E--mail re: availability of witnesses for JT

Pre-trial conference at 01-11-2016 03:30 pm.
Jury trial at 01-27-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory M Pawlak in court with attorney Nila J. Robinson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Motions filed by Defense. Defense advises of stipulation reached with State, withdraws motion to suppress statements. State makes statement. Court approves stipulation. Defense reserves right to move to suppress any further statements State may uncover. Defense presents argument regarding motions to dismiss. State presents argument. Court makes statement, denies motion. Discussion regarding jury/PTC dates.

Attorney Nila J. Robinson appears by phone.   Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Robinson requests another 7 days to file motions. State requests 10 days beyond that to respond or file motions. Defense has until 5/18/15 to file motions. State has until 5/27/15 to respond or file their motions. Court sets status for 6/02/15, will set status/motion or pretrial/trial at that time. Atty Robinson may appear by phone for next hearing. Defendant is excused from next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Motions to be filed by May 1. Telephone scheduling conference set for 5/11/15, 3:30. Defendant will not have to attend.

Defendant Gregory M Pawlak in court with attorney Nila J. Robinson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.   Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Set prelim. Defense requests return of cell phone. State presents argument, is not familiar with what law enforcement has or does not have. Defense presents further argument. State has not had a chance to review file, suggests written stipulation will be necessary.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Gregory M Pawlak appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/3/14, 10:00.
